org.foxlabs.validation.converter

Class ConverterFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.foxlabs.validation.support.AnnotationSupport
      • org.foxlabs.validation.converter.ConverterFactory

  • public abstract class ConverterFactory
extends AnnotationSupport
    Defines a factory that allows to obtain Converter instances.

    This factory has default converters for all primitive types, their wrappers and enums. Also the following types are supported by default:

    • java.lang.Class
    • java.math.BigInteger
    • java.math.BigDecimal
    • java.util.Date
    • java.util.Locale
    • java.util.TimeZone
    • java.util.logging.Level
    • java.net.URL
    • java.net.URI
    • java.io.File

    One-dimensional arrays of any registered types are supported through ArrayConverter. The java.util.Collection and java.util.Map JDK types are supported through CollectionConverter and MapConverter respectively. Additional default converters would be automatically obtained through SPI interface. The META-INF/services/org.foxlabs.validation.converter.Converter file should be used to list such converter types. Any default converter can be registered/overriden from addDefaultConverter(Converter) method at any time.

    ConverterFactory is thread-safe.

    Author:
    Fox Mulder
    See Also:
    Converter

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.foxlabs.validation.support.AnnotationSupport

      • wrapMessage

        public static <V> Converter<V> wrapMessage(Converter<V> converter,
                                           String message)
        Wraps error message of the specified converter.

        Note that this method has no effect if the specified constraint is instance of the UnsupportedConverter.

        Type Parameters:
        V - The value type.
        Parameters:
        converter - Converter to be wrapped.
        message - Error message template key.
        Returns:
        A new converter with wrapped error message.
        See Also:
        ConverterMessageWrapper

        Parameters:
        converter - Converter to be tested.
        Returns:
        true if the specified converter has wrapped error message; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        ConverterMessageWrapper

      • getDefaultConverter

        public static <V> Converter<V> getDefaultConverter(Class<V> type)
        Returns default converter for the specified value type. If there is no converter found for the specified value type then UnsupportedConverter will be returned.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The value type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of value to be converted.
        Returns:
        Converter for the specified value type.

      • createConverter

        public static <V> Converter<V> createConverter(Class<V> type,
                                               String prefix)
        Returns converter for the specified value type.

        This method differs from getDefaultConverter(Class) in that it allows to override prefix of message keys for boolean and enumeration constants.

        Type Parameters:
        V - The value type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of value to be converted.
        prefix - Prefix of message keys of boolean and enumeration constants.
        Returns:
        Converter for the specified value type.
        See Also:
        getDefaultConverter(Class), AnnotationSupport.createValidation(Class, Annotation, Class)

      • isConverterAnnotation

        public static boolean isConverterAnnotation(Annotation annotation)
        Determines if the specified annotation is either converter annotation or custom converter annotation.
        Parameters:
        annotation - Annotation to be tested.
        Returns:
        true if the specified annotation is either converter annotation or custom converter annotation; false otherwise.

      • createConverter

        public static <V> Converter<V> createConverter(Type type,
                                               Annotation[] annotations,
                                               String namespace)
        Creates a new converter for the specified generic value type using configuration from the specified annotations.

        Annotations that are not converter annotations will be skipped. Simple converters require one or none annotations. In case array/collection/map value type additional tokenizer annotation can be specified. If there are no annotations specified (empty array) then default converter will be returned.

        The converter returned may be instance of ConverterMessageWrapper if annotation contains overriding message template.

        Type Parameters:
        V - The value type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of value to be converted.
        annotations - Array of annotations.
        namespace - Namespace (for example, qualified property name).
        Returns:
        A new converter.
        Throws:
        ValidationTargetException - if there is an error in converter declaration.
        See Also:
        createConverter(Annotation, Class, String), createConverter(Class, String)

      • decode

        public static <V> V decode(Class<V> type,
                           String value)
        Converts default string representation of value into object of the specified type using registered converter.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The value type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of value to be converted.
        value - Default string representation of value.
        Returns:
        Decoded value.
        Throws:
        MalformedValueException - if conversion fails.

      • decode

        public static <V> V[] decode(Class<V> type,
                             String... values)
        Converts array of default string representations of values into array of objects of the specified type using registered converter.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The array elements type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of value to be converted.
        values - Array of default string representations of values.
        Returns:
        Decoded array of values.
        Throws:
        MalformedValueException - if conversion fails.

                                V value)
        Converts value into default string representation using registered converter.
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:

        value - Value to be encoded.
        Returns:

      • encode

        public static <V> String[] encode(Class<V> type,
                                  V... values)
        Converts array of values into array of their raw string representations using registered converter.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The array elements type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of value to be converted.
        values - Array of values to be encoded.
        Returns:
